feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:15PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain Expected Over The Southeast Interior... Rain showers are expected over the area southeast of Delta Junction and Eagle from Monday through Tuesday night. The showers could be heavy at times. Between 0.50 and 1.50 inches of rain is expected, with the heaviest amounts along the Alaska Range. This will cause sharp rises on the creeks and rivers in the Fortymile,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong wind gusts with sacttered showers will impact portions of Otero, western Kiowa, Crowley, eastern Pueblo and southwestern Bent Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 658 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered rain showers along a line extending from 10 miles north of Ordway to near Cheraw to 7 miles southwest of Higbee. Movement was east at 35 mph.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 18 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Very warm temperatures will continue through the weekend. These temperatures, combined with windy conditions, will result in significant high-mountain snowmelt once again. It is likely most small streams and creeks, and possibly some main stem rivers, will likely reach high levels again. Currently only bankfull conditions (Action Stage) to minor low-land flooding (Minor Stage Flooding) is
